flawed_nl_solution:
When 90/100 full, Karson's library holds 90/100*400 = <<90/100*400=4000/9>>4000/9 books.
If he has 120 books in the library now, he needs to buy 4000/9-120 = <<4000/9-120=2920/9>>2920/9 books to make his library 90% full.
#### 2920/9

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 360, not 4000/9. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
